image.altText: a large ferry with red livery in the sea.

props.synopsis: A quote to upgrade the Tasmanian port facility to accommodate the new Spirit of Tasmania ferries has blown out from $90 million in 2020, to $375 million just four years later.

title.children: Port upgrade for new Spirit of Tasmania ferries blows out to four times original quote

image.altText: Side-by-side images of convicted murderer Greg Lynn and his wife Melanie.

props.synopsis: Police blunders, a judge's ruling that almost torpedoed the case and a possible trip to the crime scene in an army chopper — these are the things the Greg Lynn murder trial jury wasn't told.

title.children: 'She's cackling like a hyena': Why judge kept secret recording of convicted killer Greg Lynn and wife from the jury

image.altText: Terri and Bindi Irwin stand with their arms around each other while Robert Irwin stands on a large rock behind them

props.synopsis: Bindi Irwin's joyous Tasmanian family holiday photos were sure to be on the radar of US celebrity watching media — the trouble is, they don't seem to know the difference between Tasmania and Tanzania, locations which are more than 11,000 kilometres apart.

title.children: Bindi blunder by US celebrity website mistaking Tasmania for Tanzania

image.altText: Crystal methamphetamine shards in Lego bag.

props.synopsis: An airport search found 28 grams of the drug ice on a man, hidden in toys and concealed in bags containing Lego, Tasmania Police allege.

title.children: Ice concealed in Lego packs, toys, found during airport search, Tasmania Police alleges

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone at a rally in a UK park.

props.synopsis: Julian Assange's family plan to sit back and have some beer and champagne should all go to plan and he is soon back in Australia.

title.children: Julian Assange knew 'for weeks' he was being released from UK prison

image.altText: Younger Julian sat in front of microphones with a banner reading Human Rights in front of him

props.synopsis: Julian Assange has left the United Kingdom and will plead guilty to espionage. The deal marks a new chapter in a long-running saga that saw a Townsville kid take on the United States Department of Justice.

title.children: Seven years in an embassy, five years in prison, now Julian Assange looks set to come home

image.altText: A man with tattoos on his arms, chest and neck poses for a photo, wearing a black tank top and a hat

props.synopsis: Shifty Shellshock, the frontman of American rap rock band Crazy Town, has died at his home aged 49.

title.children: Shifty Shellshock, singer of Crazy Town and 00s hit Butterfly, dies at 49

image.altText: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu and Chief of the General Staff Valery Gerasimov stand together.

props.synopsis: The court is accusing former defence minister Sergei Shoigu and chief of staff General Valery Gerasimov of war crimes and the crime against humanity of inhumane acts.

title.children: ICC issues arrest warrants for former Russian defence minister and chief of staff

image.altText: Thousands of people march in the street in a protest

props.synopsis: Protesters overwhelmed police to storm Kenya's parliament after contentious tax changes were passed by MPs.

title.children: At least 5 dead after Kenyan parliament overrun by protesters and set ablaze

image.altText: A composite image of an older man and an older woman smiling.

props.synopsis: Former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn has faced a weeks-long murder trial over the deaths of two retirees who vanished during a camping trip in Victoria's High Country more than four years ago.

title.children: Campers' families say they're 'relieved and devastated' after Greg Lynn jury delivers split verdict

image.altText: A sign outside a beer garden says "James Boag".

props.synopsis: A premium beer deeply associated with Tasmania will move operations for its mainland sales off the island to stem rising costs.

title.children: Iconic beer reliant on 'pure Tasmanian waters' to send production in part to mainland Australia

image.altText: A dozen young school children standing outside with hats on

props.synopsis: Tasmania has some of the worst education results in the country. A review has been announced to fix it, as the gap between Tasmania and the rest of the country appears to be growing.

title.children: Tasmania scrambling to close education gap with systemic review, as year 12 completion rates continue to drop

image.altText: Lisa Lynn smiles, photographed at what appears to be an indoor social setting.

props.synopsis: The mother of Greg Lynn's estranged wife blamed him for her daughter's overdose death 25 years ago, but said she accepted he was not there when her daughter died, the Supreme Court heard.

title.children: 'She was living in absolute fear': Mother of Greg Lynn's former wife held him responsible for daughter's self-inflicted overdose death

image.altText: A white DFES vehicle parked outside a house, with a taxi next to it.

props.synopsis: A middle aged couple is rushed to hospital from their Perth home after inhaling fumes when they tried to burn charcoal to stay warm amid cold overnight temperatures.

title.children: Perth couple in critical condition after burning charcoal in bedroom to stay warm

image.altText: Young smiling woman with long dark hair pulled back, holding a baby, whose face is blurred. both wearing brown, mustard clothes

props.synopsis: The missing woman's great-aunt Stella Nealon told the court that alleged murderer Anne Geeves was "nasty" to Ms Haigh and threatened to "take" her baby, during a disjointed day at court.

title.children: Accused killer Anne Geeves would watch Amber Haigh have sex with husband, court hears

image.altText: A man looks serious, standing in front of shelves stocked with vapes.

props.synopsis: Vaping businesses say they have been left in the lurch by a vape sales ban due to pass parliament and begin on Monday. They warn the closure of their businesses will push more people into the black market.

title.children: 'I'm pissed off': Vape shop owners brace for the end to their businesses, and an uncertain future

image.altText: Payman walks across the senate.

props.synopsis: Labor senator Fatima Payman has crossed the floor to vote against her party on a motion related to Palestinian recognition.

title.children: Labor senator could remain in party despite defiance on Palestinian recognition

image.altText: A man grimaces with his mouth as he stares straight ahead

props.synopsis: The NSW Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions (ODPP) said it had reached its determination after "having carefully considered the many competing factors".

title.children: Jarryd Hayne will not face a fourth trial over sexual assault allegations, DPP confirms

image.altText: Robert Trott outside a court in Timor Leste.

props.synopsis: A Timor Leste court sentences Australian man Robert Trott to 11 years in jail after he was convicted of abusing a girl under the age of 12.

title.children: Australian man sentenced to 11 years prison in Timor Leste for child sex abuse

image.altText: A shirtless man with white hair and a white beard is surrounded by a rescue team.

props.synopsis: The 34-year-old hiker has been found after 10 days in the Northern California mountains, where he survived by collecting water in his shoe.

title.children: Lukas McClish got lost in the Northern California mountains. He survived by collecting water in his shoe

image.altText: Queensland Maroons coach Billy Slater points while holding a ball in front of fullback Reece Walsh at State of Origin training.

props.synopsis: There will be no lingering demons with Queensland fullback Reece Walsh from his State of Origin I concussion when he takes to the MCG on Wednesday night, according to Maroons coach Billy Slater.

title.children: No Origin demons for Reece Walsh despite knockout in series opener, Slater says

image.altText: A premature baby.

props.synopsis: Giving premature babies high concentrations of oxygen soon after birth may reduce the risk of death by 50 per cent, according to a new study led by the University of Sydney.

title.children: Higher levels of oxygen could boost survival rates for premature babies, new study finds

image.altText: the exterior of a white apartment building

props.synopsis: The NSW government pledges to "stamp out bad behaviour" and strengthen oversight of the state's strata management industry in the wake of an ongoing ABC investigation that has revealed the systemic exploitation of unit owners and a widespread culture of kickbacks and secret commissions.

title.children: As evidence builds of strata managers exploiting apartment owners, NSW promises tougher penalties for 'bad behaviour'

image.altText: A man in a black jumper stands over another man in a white t-shirt.

props.synopsis: A hotel patron who delivered a single blow on a man at a Yorke Peninsula pub on AFL Grand Final Day, has been jailed for the "inherently dangerous" assault, which left the victim suffering a traumatic brain injury and unable to live independently.

title.children: 'Unconscious on his feet': Single punch attacker jailed for pub assault

image.altText: Julian Assange, founder of WikiLeaks (Reuters: Valentin Flauraud)

props.synopsis: The news of the WikiLeaks founder's freedom appears to be the end of a saga that goes back to 2010. Here's a recap of the last 14 years to get you up to speed.

title.children: What was Julian Assange actually charged with?

image.altText: A generic photo of two teenage schoolkids sitting side by side, using their phones.

props.synopsis: On the very first day of public hearings for the much-vaunted Joint Select Committee on Social Media and Australian Society, eSafety Commissioner Julie Inman Grant compared banning children younger than 16 from social media to banning them from the ocean.

title.children: AI execs are openly acknowledging some creative jobs may cease to exist, while McDonalds is handing its drive-thru back to the humans

image.altText: Officers in forensics uniforms outside a house.

props.synopsis: Police say they are keeping an "open mind" as they investigate whether a drug overdose caused the deaths of four people found in the living room of a home in Melbourne's north this morning.

title.children: Uncle mourns 'brilliant boy' after 17yo and three others found dead in Melbourne home

image.altText: Australia bowler Adam Zampa wipes his head with a towel after losing a T20 World Cup game against India.

props.synopsis: Afghanistan beats Bangladesh in their thrilling Super Eight showdown to progress to its first World Cup semifinal at the expense of Australia.

title.children: 'The old rainstring': Zampa jokes about Afghanistan star's time-wasting fake injury as Australia knocked out

image.altText: A small yellow tablet next to a ruler.

props.synopsis: A synthetic opioid — which has been linked to a rise in overdose deaths overseas — has emerged on the illicit drug scene, with some experts warning it has the potential to be Australia's version of a "fentanyl crisis".

title.children: A synthetic opioid stronger than fentanyl and hundreds of times more potent than heroin is emerging in Australia

image.altText: Entrance of a shopping centre with sign that reads Armada Arndale

props.synopsis: Police say they were called to an Adelaide shopping centre after reports a group of youths were threatening a man. Six teenagers have been arrested and charged with aggravated affray.

title.children: Rock-throwing, knife-yielding teens arrested in Adelaide, police say

image.altText: A man and woman sit outdoors looking at the camera with a neutral expression. The woman has her arm around him.

props.synopsis: Ten months after their dream of becoming parents turned to tragedy, these families are still fighting a giant IVF company to find out what went wrong.

title.children: 'We're never gonna forget what happened': The trauma of Amelia and Zach's IVF experience lingers

image.altText: Man looking at a phone with maps open on the screen

props.synopsis: A report by the NSW Crime Commission finds tracking devices are now part of standard toolkit for violent organised crime and their widespread use by domestic and family violence offenders is an urgent issue.

title.children: One in four people who purchased GPS tracking devices since 2023 have a history of DV, report finds

image.altText: A blue and red cargo ship loaded with hundreds of shipping containers sits in port with cranes visible beside it

props.synopsis: The cargo ship Dali, which crashed into a major Baltimore bridge killing six people, has left port three months after the catastrophe.

title.children: Ship that crashed into Baltimore bridge finally on its way
